snippet: More than 23,500 flights were canceled because of Hurricane Sandy, but the air travel system is already drawing near to relatively normal operations.
abstract: Joe Sharkey On the Road column observes more than 23,500 flights were canceled because of Hurricane Sandy, but the air travel system is already drawing near to relatively normal operations.
lead_paragraph: More than 23,500 flights were canceled because of Hurricane Sandy, but the air travel system is already drawing near to relatively normal operations.

headline.print_headline: Jump-Starting Air Travel After Everything Went Dark
headline.seo: Jump-Starting Air Travel After Hurricane Sandy
